entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
In Cuba "The Pinar del Río government decreed quarantine for the El Canal People’s Council, in the municipality of Consolación del Sur, after learning of a new case of local transmission of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19. This is the first community in Cuba that is isolated due to the epidemic." after Apr. 1
UPDATE:  "Violating the sanitary provisions established in the middle of the epidemic of coronavirus, which causes COVID-19, constitutes a crime according to Chapter 5 of the current Penal Code" after Mar. 31
Jamaica is enforcing barber shops and hairdressers to only be open between 10am and 5pm for one week after March 18.
Myanmar eases visa rules for in-country foreign employees starting March 24.
In Suriname, as of March 29th the Government of Suriname will institute a nationwide curfew for all residents with few exceptions from 8:00pm to 6:00am the next day.
Papua New Guinea "closes all national sporting facilities for four weeks as a precautionary measure" starting March 18.
On Feb 24 the Croatian Ministry of Health issued a recommendation to schools recommending not to take school trips and excursions to Italy.

As of April 3, Berlin (Germany) demands that persons who enter the city of Berlin by air at Berlin-Tegel airport "Otto Lilienthal" from a state outside the Federal Republic of Germany, if necessary also after changing at an airport within the Federal Republic, or after arrival at Berlin-Schönefeld airport by land, go directly to their flat or usual accommodation immediately after their entry and stay there permanently for a period of 14 days after their return.

Slovak government decided that COVID-19 testing will be fully centralized controlled by the state. Private laboratories and testing companies are prepared to help, but will not sell testing kits or test patients for a fee. Overall, there are 4 testing centers throughout Slovakia, each with the capacity of 700 tests a day.

On January 26th, Sri Lanka announced testing criteria for Novel Coronavirus (nCoV): 1) Patients with severe acute respiratory infection (fever, cough, and requiring admission to hospital), AND with no other aetiology that fully explains the clinical presentation AND at least one of the following: 
a. history of travel to or residence in the city of Wuhan, Hubei Province, China in the 14 days prior to symptom onset, or
b. Patient is a heath care worker who has been working in an environment  where severe acute respiratory infections of unknown aetiology are being cared for. 
2) Patients with any acute respiratory illness AND at least one of the following: 
a. close contact with a confirmed or probable case of 2019-nCoV in the 14 days prior to illness onset, or 
b. visiting or working in a live animal market in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China in the 14 days prior to symptom onset, or 
c. Worked or attended a health care facility in the 14 days prior to onset of symptoms where patients with hospital-associated 2019-nCov infections have been reported.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020. 

Policy cluster (1):
"(1)Provision and sharing of Information
a) Provide accurate information and clear message for the public, promote awareness-raising to help change people’s behavior, and encourage calm response.
- Provide accurate and clear information
- Ensure implementation of basic countermeasures against infection
- Ensure that people do not go to workplace, attend school or leave home if they are sick
- Dissemination of guidelines for visits to medical institutions (call for prior telephone consultation)
- Prevent discrimination against infected persons, close contacts and medical personnel
b) Provide appropriate information to Japanese nationals who live in countries where infection is spreading, and those who have returned to Japan, as well as to foreign nationals living or staying in Japan."
The government closed Tunisia's maritime borders, suspended all flights to and from Italy, in addition to reducing flights with Egypt, Germany, Britain and France.

On Mar 4 2020 the Croatian Institute for Public Health issued new recommendations regarding the disinfection of ambulance vehicles and sanitary vehicles: buses, trains, ships and aircraft as well as recommendations for carrying out transport activities.

March 17th: From March 18th until April 19th, Belgians are only allowed to go outside (e.g. go outside for a walk) together with the person(s) they live with, and/or with max. 1 friend from another household.
Turkmenistan has "recommended the country’s citizens to refrain from traveling to China due to the coronavirus" on January 30.

The health and social care system across the UK created a 'Coronavirus (COVID-19) action plan. "This document sets out what the UK as a whole has done – and plans to do – to tackle the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, based on [their] experience dealing with other infectious diseases and [their] influenza pandemic preparedness work."
"The Dominican Government,  [...] announced the creation of a high-level commission to monitor the coronavirus" after Mar. 14
Jamaica is enforcing a prohibition of leaving an infirmary for patients after March 25.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020.

Policy cluster (2):
"(2) Surveillance and Information gathering
-Identify suspected disease carrier based on the notification from the doctor, and conduct tests that the doctor considers necessary
-Strengthen the testing system by utilizing local and private institutes. Grasp and coordinate the PCR testing system.
-Continue to develop simple test kits for rapid diagnosis."
On April 1, the Peruvian President Vizcarra anouced the elaboration of maps showing areas with COVID-19 infections in order to concentrate isolations in affected areas.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Teleworking/working from home will be prolonged until April 19th.
Turkmenistan announced that "Citizens arriving from abroad undergo medical check-up" on February 26.
Jamaica is prohibiting any infirmary to accept new patients after March 25.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020.

Policy cluster (3):
"(3) Pandemic Prevention
- Present appropriate measures to prevent clusters and reduce contacts, based on the local situations.
- Request that necessary measures be taken, such as closing off facilities and refraining from holding events, if there is a possibility that a cluster may be occurring,
- Call for cooperation in self-restraint in avoiding gatherings in closed spaces,
3. Key Points
(Provisional translation)
      2
crowded places, or close-contact settings. Pay particular attention to metropolitan areas.
-Secure and foster experts in measures against cluster and strengthen the health center system.
- Ensure thorough infection control measures in places including the followings
--Medical institutions --Elderly facilities --School
--Public transport
-- Workplace (actively promote tele-work and staggered commuting)
- Continue to implement entry restrictions, travel warnings, strengthened quarantine, and visa restrictions, from the viewpoint of preventing the flow of infected people into Japan"

The provincial government of DKI Jakarta issued a policy to limit operations and schedules of public transportations, such as the MRT, Transjakarta, and LRT. Public transport will be available from 06:00-20:00, with reductions of units/cars/trains and limits on passengers. The policy takes into effect starting from March 23.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On April 2nd 2020, the UAE extended the suspension of entry of all foreign nationals holding a valid UAE residence visa for a renewable period of two weeks.

The Ministry of Religious Affaires invites citizens to respect the health and regulatory measures issued by the Ministry of Health, as it invites imams to shorten their sermons and reduce the time between the call to prayer and prayer. The Ministry also calls on citizens to do their ablutions at home before going to the mosque and to bring their own prayer mat.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020.

Policy cluster (4):
"(4) Medicare
- Secure a flexible medical provision system in each region, depending on the spread of infection.
- Perform tests at the discretion of the doctor and, if a patient is found, provide recommendations and necessary measures for admission to hospitals to provide appropriate medical care.
- Establish a system for those with mild symptoms to be cared at home, in areas where there is a risk that an increase in patients of the Coronavirus may interfere with the provision of hospitalized medical care for other severely ill patients.
- To prepare for possible significant increase of patients in Japan, secure medical provision structure including through considering division of roles among medical institutions in each region. Secure necessary beds, personnel, and necessary medical equipment such as respirators.
- Strengthen the system for providing medical interpreters and accelerate clinical research and treatment to verify the effects of therapeutic agents"
Turkmenistan established a coronavirus hotline on April 1.
Solomon Island government is closing Kukum Market and Fishing Village market indefinitely from Monday 23rd March 2020.
Angola is demanding the disinfection of all public transportation twice a day and the providence of hand sanitiser by the entities for the passengers and drivers after March 25

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 23, the Slovenian government changed the methodology of testing. People over 60 and those with immune deficiencies and mild symptoms will now be tested.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020.
   
Policy cluster (5):
"(5) Economic and employment measures
Expeditiously implement necessary and sufficient economic and fiscal
policies without pause, taking bold measures to return the Japanese economy to a solid growth trajectory"

The National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC) has been activated as part of Samoa’s response to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) global crisis.
The Proclamation of Emergency period is from 21 March to 4 April 2020.
On March 24, Slovak Government decides that residents should only appear in public with a mask covering their mouth and face.

Japan issued an update of the "Basic Policies for Novel Coronavirus Control" on March 28th, 2020.

Policy cluster (6):
"(6) Other important notes
- Consideration of human rights
- Supply of goods and materials (increase production and ensure smooth supply of masks, disinfectants, foodstuffs, etc.; distribute such items by the government to medical institutions and nursing care facilities for the elderly; prohibit resale of masks, etc.)
- The government will work closely with the international community to collect information on the response by WHO and other countries and regions. In addition, we will actively share the knowledge obtained in Japan with related organizations such as WHO and other countries and regions, and contribute to the measures of the international community as a whole in relation to countries and regions including emerging and developing countries. - Maintaining social functions
- Decisions on the declaration of emergency will be made based on a comprehensive assessment, taking into account the opinions of the Advisory Committee."
On March 24, Slovak Government mandates citizens to maintain 2 meters distance away from each other when standing in a queue.

On 13 March 2020 the Australian Health Protection Principal Committee (AHPPC), National, State and Territory governments have agreed to provide public advice against holding non-essential, organised public gatherings of more than 500 people from 16 March 2020.

On January 26th 2020, Sri Lanka announced that all passengers from flights originated from China need to be screened for temperature. If a passenger with elevated temperature is detected, he/she should be given a surgical mask to wear and taken to the health office. 

All suspected 2019-nCoV patients need to be screened by airport health office (APHO) medical officers. Consent for examination and further assessment should be obtained from the traveler or parent of guardian. If consent is not given, the traveler/s will be managed under the authority given by the Quarantine and Prevention of Diseases Ordinance. 

If the traveler has a contact history and fever/signs and symptoms, the traveler should be transferred to IDH/ designated hospitals.Director or a designed officer from these hospitals should immediately contact the Chief Epidemiologist and the D Quarantine and should immediately provide relevant patient information for required surveillance, prevention and further actions.

Passengers Locator Form should be filled for those travelers with suspected nCoV seated in the same row and two rows in front and behind the index suspected case. The details should be communicated to the Epidemiology Unit, which will carry out the community level contact tracing and house quarantine of asymptomatic contacts with the help of Regional Epidemiologist and MOOH.
On March 24, Slovak Government ruled that there are to be temperature checks at the entrance of hospitals, shops, factories and places where people gather.
On March 27, the Slovenian government announced all Slovenians returning from coronavirus hotspots would be put into state-administrated quarantine.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Ethiopia is enforcing a two-week quarantine on all passengers, including Ethiopian nationals in designated hotels at their own personal cost from March 20.

On 13 March 2020, the Australian Government announced that it had updated its "Smartraveller" travel advice website for all Australians travelling overseas to level 3 - ‘reconsider your need for overseas travel at this time.’

"Japan decided to provide the Kingdom of Cambodia [...] with [...] personal protective equipment stockpiled by Asia-Europe Foundation (ASEF) and financed by Japan’s contribution, as in-kind contribution from the Government of Japan."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
The Honiara City Council (HCC) is calling on market vendors to voluntarily remove their belongings from informal market spots.
A notice from HCC has advised market vendors to voluntarily remove their tables from these specified locations.
Custom Garden Market, Panatina Area, Fishing Village Market, Kobito, Border area, Kukum area, Fijian Quarter Market, Talise, Lengakiki/Mbuburu area, Rove Market, White River 01 and 02 Market.
The council said once they confiscate tables and items from these informal markets they will destroy them.
“Anyone obstructing or not complying will be prosecuted”, the notice said.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 28, Slovenia banned flights to and from non-EU countries until further notice while flights to and from EU destinations remain suspended until 13 April.
As of March 3, it is obligatory for people circulating outside to wear face masks. The measure lasts at least until April 12.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

These measures apply to citizens of Germany, France, Switzerland, Spain, Austria, the UK, the Netherlands, and Sweden. They will be required to undergo strict self-quarantine measures.

Papua New Guinea bans entry for "passengers who have been in China (People's Rep.), Iran, Italy, Japan or Korea (Rep.) in the past 14 days...they must have spent 14 consecutive days in a country that is free from Coronavirus"
On March 13, Indonesia's Minister of Home Affairs recommends that all regional/local governments suspend official outbound travels.
From April 2, Iraq is exempting "all medicines, medical supplies and devices, diagnostic and laboratory equipment from import license regulations".

This Centre is headed by Lieutenant General Shavendra Silva, Chief of Defence Sta􀃠 and Commander of the Army.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

As of March 22, 2020, the Kuwait government has announced that all private medical offices, clinics, and laboratories will be closed until further notice. Public and private hospitals and private hospital clinics remain open.

Mar 14 Istria County his shuttering all hospitality businesses for the next month in a move to try and curb the spread of the coronavirus. All cafes and restaurants will be closed until April 14. Food delivery services and soup kitchens are exempt but are under strict cautionary measures, said Damir Kozlovac, the head of county civil defense services.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Except in exceptional circumstances with Cabinet approval, starting from 12am of Thursday morning, 26 March 2020, all international travel to and from Samoa by plane is ceased.

Denmark is ordering home quarantine for all infected people that have no or mild symptoms and are not considered particularly vulnerable are placed with daily contact from health professionals. Anybody that has been in close contact with someone who is known to be infected by SARS-CoV-2 is placed in home quarantine as well. Quarantine in those cases is enforced for 14 days. The policy was announced on 29 February 2020.

On January 28, Singapore announced that "the Ministry of Health (MOH) is contacting all recent travellers from Hubei province who are in Singapore. MOH will assess who among this group are at higher risk and will place them under quarantine. Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and foreigners on long-term visas will be quarantined at home or other suitable facilities. Those on short-term visas will be housed at Government Quarantine Facilities."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The North Korean National People's Congress extends days of quarantine to 30.
On 16 March 2020, the Australian Government imposed a universal precautionary self-isolation requirement on all international arrivals, effective as at 11:59pm Sunday 15 March 2020.
From March 22, Iraq has put a ban on foreign travelers coming from Nigeria and Turkey, excluding diplomats.

As of March 13, 2020 the Bulgarian government recommends to set-up anti-epidemic measures regarding the work environment. Foremost all employers should do everything to make home-office possible. If this isn't possible because of specific job-related characteristics, measures to decrease the danger of infection should be provided, such as disinfection, ventilation, personal hygiene awareness and reducing social contacts within the work environment to a minimum.

Slovak Government instates a state of emergency in retirement homes, placing heightened hygiene measures. Senior citizens are advised to self-quarantine in their home and limit physical contact with all persons, including family members. Municipalities are to set up special call lines through which senior citizens could order deliveries of food and groceries.

Mar. 8 --- The government of the Maldives and the Tourism Ministry of the Maldives with the guidance of the Health Protection Agency of the Maldives (HPA) placed a temporary travel restriction for the passengers originating from, transiting to or with a travel history from Italy.

  Maldivians and spouses of Maldivians who are foreign nationals will be allowed in but may be subject to quarantine measures.
On March 15, Surinamese residents, who arrive back in Suriname, will be  required to spend 14 days in a government quarantine centre.

In Japan, Tokyo's governor said "Tokyo’s 14 million people should avoid visits to bars and restaurants, and put karaoke sessions on hold". Furthermore, residents have been asked to "refrain from going out in the evenings, and to refrain from all unnecessary outings at the weekend” This is effective until 12 April.

On 16 March 2020, the Australian Government banned cruise ships from foreign ports (including round trip international cruises originating in Australia) from arriving at Australian ports for an initial 30 days
On March 20, Ethiopia released a policy paper stating the of harassment of foreign nationals as "not acceptable and un-Ethiopian", emphasizing the need to undertake prevention measures instead.
On March 24, Slovak government announces shopping hours (between 9am and 12pm) exclusively for citizens over 65 years of age.

Papua New Guinea announced on March 13 that "an isolation ward of 8 beds is ready at the Port Moresby General Hospital (PMGH). Nurses and doctors involved in the response have received training and have personal protective equipment (PPE) in stock."
On March 24, Slovak Government announces plans to cooperative with mobile network providers and send emergency messages with COVID-19 information directly to the phones of vulnerable citizens.

In Israel, on March 22, 2020, the Ministry of Health launches "app that allows the identification of contacts between diagnosed patients and people who came in contact with them in the 14 days prior to the patient's diagnosis of the Coronavirus".

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On January 28, Singapore announced that "the Ministry of Health (MOH) is contacting all recent travellers from Hubei province who are already in Singapore. MOH will assess who among this group are at higher risk and will place them under quarantine. Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and foreigners on long-term visas will be quarantined at home or other suitable facilities. Those on short-term visas will be housed at Government Quarantine Facilities. All residents and long-term passport holders, returning to Singapore soon, either with travel history in Hubei OR with PRC passports issued in Hubei, will be quarantined at home or other suitable facilities.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On Mar 17 the Croatian national civil defense headquarters has once again called to limit the movement of the elderly so that they do not leave their residences unless absolutely necessary.
Moxico, Angola, is training 240 health professionals (doctors, nurses, and cleaning staff) to deal with the disease after March 26

Taiwan CDC together with  Ministry of Transportation and Communications (MOTC) announce that public transportation ridership should be disinfected on Feb. 19. Carriages of the Taiwan High Speed Rail (THSR) and Taiwan Railways (TR) should be cleaned and disinfected at least once a day; points of frequent contact inside THSR carriages (e.g., armrests, tables) once each round trip; and points of frequent contact in metro carriages once every eight hours.
Working conditions for state of emergency (SOE) for Coronavirus (COVID-19) includes partial shutdown of non-essential government services from March 23.
Indonesia's Minister of Administrative and Bureaucratic Reform issued a policy to suspend all official government outbound travels. The policy is to take into effect on March 16 - 31.

Mar. 15 --- The government of the Maldives and the Tourism Ministry of the Maldives with the guidance of the Health Protection Agency of the Maldives (HPA) placed a temporary travel restriction for the passengers originating from, transiting to or with a travel history from Germany (Bavaria, North Rhine-Westphalia and Baden-Württemberg), Spain (All provinces and regions) and France (Île-de-France and Grand Est).

 Maldivians and spouses of Maldivians who are foreign nationals will be allowed in but may be subject to quarantine measures.

On March 24, Slovak Government announces that all shops which remain in operation are to be closed on Sundays. The purpose of this policy is to use the day to disinfect store facilities as well as alleviate the strain on workers employed in essential businesses.

A public information campaign focusing on the importance of washing hands for 20 seconds has been started in the UK to slow down the spread of coronavirus. "The campaign will appear in the print media, radio, online and in public places, including billboards".
Ethiopia demands volunteers that have been undertaking coordination tasks to also adhere to self-protection and prevention protocols while continuing to undertake voluntary tasks, from March 20.
On Mar 17 the Croatian National Civil Protection has decided to close 27 border crossings with neighboring Slovenia.
Papua New Guinea "disseminated messages on effective hand washing and personal hygiene in schools in Port Moresby"
National curfew applies throughout the Tunisian Territory between 6 pm and 6 am.
Botswana declares state of emergency, only persons performing essential  services may leave the house, a travel permit has to be filled out

As of March 11, 2020, non-Kuwaiti citizens are barred from entering Kuwait through the airport. This does not apply to first degree relatives who are traveling with their Kuwaiti family member. The Kuwait Cabinet has also authorised the Ministry of Interior to suspend granting of all types of visas except for those used by diplomatic delegations.

On 24 March, it was announced that  the Surinamese ministry and a focal point of the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), led by the Director of Health, have assembled the National Public Health Response team (response team) to develop strategies to inform the general public and individuals entering the country about preventive actions to prevent the spread the Coronavirus.

On March 23, Turkmenistan has developed a temporary regulation on the movement of export, import and transit cargo through the territory of Turkmenistan. "Goods arriving by car through the customs checkpoints "Garabogaz" and "Farap" and following further on the territory of Turkmenistan will be transported by Turkmen cargo carriers." "The transfer of goods delivered in trailers or semi-trailers will be carried out in non-contact conditions at the state border in certain places.""Also, starting from March 24, all types of cargo that will arrive at the international seaport of Turkmenbashi should be loaded in trailers and semi-trailers to sea vessels and sent without accompanying individuals and without motor transport."
The Ugandan Ministry of Health shared measures on February 22, 2020, to be practiced by residents of Uganda so as to prevent spread of Covid-19.
Namibe, Angola, is training 30 health professionals to deal with the disease after March 26

As of March 17, 2020, Benin issues a compulsory 14-day quarantine of all persons coming to Benin by air; for nationals, costs for quarantine covered by the state; foreign nationals bear their own costs

As of March 13, 2020, the Bulgarian Government suspends and forbids consultations for children and pregnant women, prophylactic examinations and immunizations, planned operations, including the transplantation of organs from living and carcass donors, and visits to all medical establishments shall be suspended.
On Feb. 24 Taiwan CECC raises travel notice level for South Korea to Level 3: Warning, advises against all non-essential travel.
Ethiopia is calling upon all medical professionals, including those in training, to be ready for the call of national duty, from March 20.
Turkmenistan announced that it had rolled out a public health campaign targeted at school children and other citizens, Feb. 7.

On January 28, Singapore announced that "New visitors with travel history in Hubei or with PRC passports issued in Hubei will not be allowed to enter or transit through Singapore. The issuance of all forms of new visas to those with PRC passports issued in Hubei will be suspended and previously issued short-term and multiple-visit visas, as well as visa-free transit facilities, for those with PRC passports issued in Hubei, will also be suspended with immediate effect."
Taiwan CECC announces that starting from February 27, Taiwanese nationals entering Taiwan from South Korea must undergo a 14-day period of home quarantine on Feb. 24.

Peru is readying an economic stimulus package worth around 90 billion soles ($ 26.41 billion), divided into three phases: 1) containment of the disease, 2) ensuring of payment chains by granting credit guarantees and 3) reactivation of production.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Ministry of Administrative and Bureaucratic Reform advises all government officials/civil servants to suspend official outbound travels starting from March 16.

Curfew from 6pm to 6am in Dominica until 20th of April

In Turkey, the government has provided public awareness for all citizens in the form of promoting standard EN149 filtered masks against the virus, which have been initially recommended by the institution of medicine and medical equipment (İlaç ve Tıbbi Cihaz Kurumu), connected to the Ministry of Health.

Slovak medical administration will give priority to licensing COVID-19 testing and treatment. New proposed therapeutics will be prioritized and their approval process will be streamlined as much as (safely) possible.

"The clinics will be a one-stop-shop for people who are concerned they may have the virus, to be tested and isolated from other patients. "

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
On January 26th 2020, Sri Lanka announced that all passengers from flights originated from China need to be screened for temperature. If a passenger with elevated temperature is detected, he/she should be given a surgical mask to wear and taken to the health office.
   
   All suspected 2019-nCoV patients need to be screened by airport health office (APHO) medical officers. Consent for examination and further assessment should be obtained from the traveler or parent of guardian. If consent is not given, the traveler/s will be managed under the authority given by the Quarantine and Prevention of Diseases Ordinance.
   
   If the traveler has a contact history and fever/signs and symptoms, the traveler should be transferred to IDH/ designated hospitals.Director or a designed officer from these hospitals should immediately contact the Chief Epidemiologist and the D Quarantine and should immediately provide relevant patient information for required surveillance, prevention and further actions.
   
   Passengers Locator Form should be filled for those travelers with suspected nCoV seated in the same row and two rows in front and behind the index suspected case. The details should be communicated to the Epidemiology Unit, which will carry out the community level contact tracing and house quarantine of asymptomatic contacts with the help of Regional Epidemiologist and MOOH.

Sri Lanka established the Presidential Task Force on March 26th to combat COVID – 19 with the responsibility to ensure that the civilian life moves on without any hindrance.

The membership of the Task Force is 40 including Provincial Governors, several Secretaries to Ministries, Commanders of Tri-Forces, security chiefs including Acting Inspector General of Police, Chairmen of several Departments, Corporations and Authorities and District and Divisional Secretaries.

The President had declared powers and functions of the Task Force through a special gazette notification.

The Task Force should carry out its responsibilities covering every district in the country while giving priority to districts of Colombo, Kalutara, Gampaha, Puttalam, Jaffana, Mannar, Kilinochchi, Vavuniya and Mullaitivu which have been identified as fasing a greater risk.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Cambodia closes all schools in the towns of Siem Reap and Phnom Penh as of March 14.
Denmark has closed all its public schools and universities. This was announced on 11 March and implemented on 16 March 2020. At first it was announced for two weeks.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On April 1, Berlin (Germany) and Brandenburg (Germany) declare that "the Berlin-Brandenburg State Laboratory (LLBB) has built up an analytical capacity of 200 tests per day in its laboratories at its site in Frankfurt (Oder) and that Bayer AG also makes its laboratory capacities available for COVID 19 analysis. Further, a test laboratory is being built on two floors at the company's site in Berlin-Wedding so that in the future up to 1,000 additional SARS-CoV-2 tests can be carried out here every day. The equipment and personnel required for the analyses come from all areas of research and development at Bayer."
On January 27, Guizhou medical team of 135 members departed for Wuhan
Kyrgyzstan establishes a hotline for people to ask questions on the coronavirus on Jan. 27.
On Mar 22 the Croatian Ministry of Interior ordered the closure of farm produce markets.

On February 04, Singapore took additional precautionary measures to minimise congregation of students in large numbers. "Ministry of Education implemented the following in primary and secondary schools, Special Education (SPED) schools, Junior Colleges and Millennia Institute: suspension of large group and communal activities such as assemblies, camps and mass celebrations, staggered recess time, after school programmes to be held in smaller groups". For preschools, large group and communal activities such as assemblies, excursions, fieldtrips and mass celebrations were also suspended.
On 18 March 2020, the Australian Health Minister exercised his biosecurity emergency powers and banned international cruise ships from entering Australian ports before 15 April 2020.
On 22th Jan, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Public health commanded all hospitals to scale up disease surveillance and prevention to the highest standards for emerging infectious diseases.

Canada, ON, March 11 "Our government has also recently instructed long-term care homes to begin active screening of staff, students, volunteers, visitors, residents moving into a long-term care home and residents returning to a long-term care home. These individuals will now be proactively checked for symptoms and asked about recent travel history and contacts."
The government of Antigua and Barbuda is enforcing a nationwide curfew with few exceptions from 28th of March for two weeks. The curfew will be in place from 8PM to 6AM.

As of April 1, Brandenburg (Germany) issues professional licences for doctors trained in Poland by a decree of the Ministry of Health. Polish medical graduates are granted a largely unrestricted professional permit, limited to 12 months - if necessary 13 months - upon application. Within this period, a knowledge test must be passed.
On 22nd Jan, DPM and MoPH announced that the Emergency Operations Center (EOC) has been scaled up to Level 3.
South Sudan has closed all schools and universities for a month, beginning March 20.

Angola declares that all those infected with Covid-19 or SARS-Cov2, or those under active surveillance by the health authorities are to stay in quarantine, either domiciliary or institutional, as part of the state of emergency after March 27. Breaking quarantine will be constituted as a crime of disobedience.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Denmark has closed all its public schools and universities until April 13. A number of exceptions apply, e.g. for children with special needs. Emergency child care is warranted.

On 19 March 2020, the Australian Government announced that borders would be closed to all non-citizens and non-residents from 20 March 2020, 9pm AEDT. New Zealand citizens who live in Australia as Australian residents are also exempt, as are New Zealanders transiting to New Zealand. Exemptions for Pacific Islanders transiting to their home countries will continue to apply.
On 21st Jan, travelers to Thailand were issued Health Beware Cards  for an advisory on nCoV,
Korea Department of Health and Welfare declares rules for preventing infectious diseases during the Lunar New Year holidays.

Canada, ONT, March 12 "the Minister of Education has issued a Ministerial Order to close all publicly funded schools in Ontario for two weeks following March break, in response to the emergence in Ontario of COVID-19"

On Mar 22 the Croatian Ministry of Interior declared: people will be banned from leaving their place of residence as of Mar 23. 
Exempt from the measure are: those are important for transport that is necessary for supply, daily migrations, the employed in important services for healthcare and veterinary protection, delivery of medicines, sanitary materials, maintaining utilities, water supply and sewage, provision of natural gas and electricity, informing the public, journalists, citizens that require urgent medical assistance, vital family reasons, travelling to work and from work if doing a job is absolutely necessary and can’t be done from home, as well as urgent operative services that are taking part in preventing spread of the disease.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Belarus, March 26th The Ministry of Health has updated external Border restrictions by extending the list of countries with dangerous epidemic situation - Italy, Iran, South Korea, France, Germany, Spain, Poland and the Czech Republic. Ministry organised the collection of biological material for laboratory research and temperature checks.

India issues following entry condition —
"passengers traveling from /having visited Italy or Republic of Korea and desirous of entering India will need certificate of having tested negative for COVID-19 from the designated laboratories authorized by the health
authorities of these countries."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Angola is restricting the free movement of individuals, which are only allowed to leave their homes for a small number of reasons, as part of the state of emergency after March 27. Mass gathering are also restricted.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Cambodia closes all educational institutions across the country as of March 16.

Canada, Ont, March 13 "To help contain the spread of COVID-19, Dr. David Williams, Ontario's Chief Medical Officer of Health, has recommended the immediate suspension of all gatherings over 250 people because of this pandemic."
On 26th Jan, Public is advised: Regularly wash hands with water and soap or use an alcohol gel. It is also recommended to avoid using your hands to touch your eyes, nose, and mouth.

On February 3, Singapore issued advisory for precautionary measures in preschools. These included continuation of health checks for for all children, staff and visitors, ensuring  good personal hygiene and environmental hygiene.
On 26th Jan, Thai public is advised: While travelling abroad, people should wear a mask and avoid visiting crowded places or making contact with patients who cough and sneeze.

From March 23, South Sudan has halted all international flights and closed its land borders, making exceptions for food supply, emergency transport, humanitarian aid, cargo trucks, and flights landing due to technical difficulties.
In Thailand on 26th Jan, the public was advised not to believe all of the circulating rumors from different sources.

Following loading or unloading they can be in self-isolation at their homes and no longer have to go into quarantine. If they notice any kind of symptoms they must contact their doctors.
Papua New Guinea "has budgeted $US13 million for an Emergency Response Plan to prepare and respond to the coronavirus threat"

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On February 03, Singapore issued an advisory of 14-day Leave of Absence for all preschool children with any household member who is on Home Quarantine Order, as well as an LOA for "14-day Leave of Absence for all preschool staff and children returning from Mainland China: i. on and from 28 January 2020, ii. as well as those who returned within the last 14 days prior to 28 January, i.e. 14 January to 27 January 2020."
Cebu imposes 24-hour curfew for students and elders. (announced and effective on Mar. 22)

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The government of Antigua and Barbuda imposes a nationwide 24 hour curfew on the 2nd of April until April the 9th. A curfew from 8PM to 6AM had been imposed earlier on the 27th of March and should have lasted until the 11th of April.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Canada, Ont, March 13 "intermittent inmates who serve time on the weekends will be required to attend their reporting facility, where they will be given a temporary absence from custody and permitted to return home. Intermittent inmates have already been deemed low-risk by the courts and remain in the community Monday to Friday to live and work.
In addition, we are temporarily suspending personal visits within our adult correctional facilities across the province. This suspension will come into effect on March 14, 2020 and remain until further notice. Professional visits including legal counsel will continue."

The Ministry of Public Health in Qatar "advises citizens and residents against traveling to China, and advised to avoid traveling unnecessarily to countries that announced an outbreak (COVID19) including South Korea, Japan, Singapore and Iran, whether for tourism, work or other reasons." 

The ministry also "calls on all travelers coming from the mentioned countries to monitor their health status within 14 days of returning from those countries and to communicate with the designated health authorities as soon as any symptoms related to respiratory infections appear."
On 31st Jan, Thailand encourages people to bring a mask when going outside of their residences, and frequently wash hands with soap and water or alcohol gel.
The Republic of South Africa declares a state of disaster on March 15 2020

Cunene, Angola, is making 90 million Kwanzas available to ensure logistical services for prevention of the disease after March 27

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

On January 27, Sichuan medical team of 150 members departed for Wuhan
Kyrgyzstan will set up "Quarantine points...on the border crossing points with Kazakhstan." Jan. 27.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
​In line with rapid COVID-19 developments the Ministry of Public Health (MOPH) has taken a number of additional measures to monitor and detect any suspected cases, and has implemented all recommendations issued by the World Health Organization (WHO) in this regard.​

​​Coordination has been made with the concerned authorities to examine all travelers coming from countries that have recorded a significant increase in the outbreak of the virus.

A number of residential buildings equipped with all required amenities have been prepared to host people who meet the quarantine standards, while continuing to screen people who show fever and respiratory symptoms to be transferred to the Communicable Disease Center, to do the necessary checks and provide the appropriate treatment.

MOPH recommends postponing traveling to China, South Korea, Iran, Singapore, Japan and Italy.
On Jan. 27, in Kyrgyzstan, the health minister "asked to reduce the number of mass public events, to exercise caution in crowded places."
Canada, Ont, March 16 "The Ministry of Health has requested the closure of all bars and restaurants, with the exception of restaurants that can shift to takeout/delivery mechanisms"
Cuanza Norte, Angola, is opening two centres for the testing and quarantine after March 27
Canada, Ont, March 16 "The Ministry of Health has requested the closure of recreational facilities and libraries, and churches and other faith settings"
DR Congo implements three-week confinement in Kinshasa starting 28 March.

On March 15, the "Ministry of Health (MOH) has advised the public to defer all travel abroad. Employers and employees should defer all work-related travel plans, and employers should remind employees of MOH’s travel advisory to defer all travel abroad.
The health minister in Kyrgyzstan asked people to wear face masks in public starting Jan. 27.

Qatar's MOPH "has launched a webpage dedicated to providing reliable information and data regarding the coronavirus to the population of Qatar in Arabic, English, Hindi, Malayalam, Chinese and French".

On 22 March 2020, the Australian Government announced that as of midday local time 23 March 2020, the following facilities will be closed: pubs, registered and licenced clubs (excluding bottle shops attached to these venues), hotels (excluding accommodation); gyms and indoor sporting venues; cinemas, entertainment venues, casinos, and night clubs; restaurants and cafes will be restricted to takeaway and/or home delivery; religious gatherings, places of worship or funerals (in enclosed spaces and other than very small groups and where the 1 person per 4 square metre rule applies).

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Canada, Ont, March 17 "Today, the Government of Ontario announced that it is taking decisive action by making an order declaring an emergency under s 7.0.1 (1) the Emergency Management and Civil Protection Act."
Kyrgyzstan: "Kyrgyz-Chinese border had been closed since 23 January."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The 3-week confinement in Kinshasa set to begin on March 28 has been reported to a later date.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On February 07, Singapore "suspended all external school activities and inter-school activities until the end of the March school holidays". Additionally, at a school where a teacher tested positive for the virus, "students, teachers and staff who had recently come into contact with the teacher will be issued with a 14-day Leave of Absence (LOA). Co-curricular activities there have also been suspended for two weeks with immediate effect. Instead of lectures, there will be more tutorial size classes. The school is also cleaning and disinfecting the school premises thoroughly."
The Department of Health and Welfare declares PRC as a contamination zone and implementation of the monitoring of inbound travelers.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: DR Congo announces that the 3-week confinement originally set for Kinshasa will only be in the city's province of Gombe, thought to be its epicenter.

On January 31st, Guatemala announces that the Minister of National Defense will monitor seaports and ships entering Guatemalan waters. The collection of relevant travel information and the health monitoring of all crew members will be done by the army. Cargo can still be unloaded but crew members are not allowed to exit the boats.
"Import of any agricultural products from China into Kyrgyzstan has been suspended until February 1. "

Canada, Ont, March 18 "In order to assist the province with its efforts to keep Ontarians safe during this time, all provincial parks will be closed to the public from March 19, 2020 until April 30, 2020."
Cuanhama (Cunene, Angola) is educating merchants on prevention methods after March 31
The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all institutions of learning - from Kindergarten to Colleges - will be closed starting from 27th March 2020, issued on 26th March 2020.

On February 7, Singapore adopted new measures to "ensure the health and safety of our blood donors by screening potential donors and their companions for fever or respiratory symptoms, such as cough or runny nose, as well as their travel history to Mainland China, before they can enter the blood banks or mobile drive premises.
From January 24, China Railway offered a full refund for all train tickets.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On February 1st, the boat Green Star was allowed to dock at a Guatemalan port and unload its cargo after monitoring and health tests were conducted by the Guatemalan army. Crew members were not allowed to leave the boat.

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all public transport vehicles - buses, minibuses and taxis – in all the cities will stop services from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, March 27th.  Use of trucks for public transport is illicit and punishable by law. With the exception of those who may be granted special permit by the competent authority in urgent circumstances, all public transport services from one Region to another, or from one city to another, will likewise be stopped from 6:00 a.m. tomorrow, 27 March 2020.

On 16.03.2020 Houthi authorities said they had closed land borders with government-controlled parts of Yemen for two weeks except to goods traffic (commercial and humanitarian shipments). All other land crossings have been closed too.

The Republic of Congo's government declared to the public to "be vigilant and all travelers from high-risk countries to quarantine themselves for 14 days" after confirming the country's first case March 14th.

On February 7, Enterprise Singapore, a statutory board under the Ministry of Trade and Industry in Singapore, released a Guide on Business
Continuity Planning for COVID-19, in keeping with latest government advisories.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Guatemala asks all citizens not to panic and to retrieve all information from official sources.
The Ivory coast closes "all night- clubs, movie theatres, and performance venues for 15 days, with the possibility to extend the ban, starting at midnight on the 18th of March."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Lebanon is distributing flyers and posters in every government administration on how to deal with the Covid-19 based on the World Health Organization (WHO)
On March 20, Gabon orders the closing of all businesses except restaurants that deliver food, markets for food consumption, and hair salons (which may receive one customer at a time.)
The Ivory Coast is enforcing a ban "on gatherings of more than 50 people during a period of 15 days, with a possibility to be renewed, starting on the 18th of March at midnight".

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Ministry of Health and Welfare declares the state of national 'alert.'

All employees of these enterprises will not be laid off and their full salary for  the period in question will be borne by the employer.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Canada, Ont, March 23 "To further contain the spread of COVID-19, the Ontario Government will order the mandatory closure of all non-essential workplaces effective as of Tuesday, March 24th at 11:59 p.m. This closure will be in effect for 14 days with the possibility of extending this order as the situation evolves. A full list of businesses that are permitted to stay open will be released tomorrow."

On February 08, Singapore put in additional measures to protect preschools, including "Limit visitors entering the premises only to those needed to support the running of preschools (e.g. contractors) and agencies who need to perform essential functions and limiting deployment of staff across centres to prevent transmission between preschools"

On February 21st, Guatemala announces that it sent a specialist from the National Health Laboratory to a training session in Mexico to learn how to diagnose a person with the coronavirus. The delivery of diagnostic materials for the detection of the virus (primers and positive controls) was also made. Previously, Guatemala had to send the samples to the CDC in Atlanta in the United States, which could take days to obtain the result; however, now the laboratory can diagnose the virus in a matter of hours.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

From 5 February 2020, obtain travel declarations for visitors into the preschool. Ensure that visitors have not travelled to Mainland China in the past 14 days."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

● Scarf sneeze (inner arm angle)

Costa Rica, 16.03.2020: 
A state of emergency is declared for the entire territory of the Republic of Costa Rica, due to the sanitary emergency caused by COVID-19disease.

The Ivory Coast enforces a "strict prohibition on the consumption of bushmeat".

"The Kyrgyz government has restricted travel beyond Kyrgyzstan with ID card since March 1. The travel to other countries will be possible only with international travel passport."

Latvia recommends to cancel all unneccessary travel abroad

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
The Israeli Government approved new, extended emergency regulations aimed at creating "social distance" on March 25, 2020 that include inter alia:
- it is not permitted to leave a place of residence to the public space expect for special cases 
- Departure of an individual or persons living in the same place only for a short time and up to 100 meters from the place of residence
- the enforcement of regulations by the police

The Ministry of Health of Eritrea announces that all trading activities and transactions will be banned in this period (21 days). Similarly, weekly markets that occur in various parts of the country will remain closed.  Food production, supply and processing enterprises as well as grocery stores, pharmacies and banks will however continue to provide services. These institutions will close at 8:00 pm every evening. Major productive and service sectors (manufacturing, food processing, construction, Trucking etc.) will continue their functions. Citizens in the rural areas engaged in farming and animal husbandry will continue to engage in their vital developmental tasks. All personnel of the public and private bodies that will continue their operations will be issued with permits by their respective institutions, from 2nd April 2020 onwards.
Canada, Nunavut, April 1 "No visitors will be allowed at long term care facilities in Nunavut – Continuing Care Centres (CCCs) and Elders’ Homes."

On March 25, Singapore issued advisories for foreign domestic workers brought into the country (under slim chances of approval to do so). "Upon arrival in Singapore, FDWs from overseas must serve a 14-day Stay-Home Notice (SHN) at an alternative accommodation, after which their work permits would be issued. For FDWs who transited at or travelled from UK or US and enter Singapore from 25 March 2020, 2359 hrs, they are required to serve their 14-day Stay-Home Notice (SHN) at designated facilities.
In Israel, on March 25, 2020, it was decided that "public transport services would be reduced to around 25%".

On March 5: "A national crisis center has been set up with the Kyrgyz government to adopt measures aimed at minimizing negative economic effects of the spread of covid-19 coronavirus in the world." (Kyrgyzstan)
The Ivory Coast's ministry of transports forbids the accompanying and welcoming of travelers in airports.
Colobia (Medellin) makes mandatory mask on public transport starting April 6
Canada, Nunavut, April 1 "Those returning to Nunavut require approval from the Office of the Chief Public Health Officer"

On March 25, Singapore issued a new notice for foreign domestic workers to "spend their rest day at home during in view of the introduction of social distancing measures. If FDWs agree to spend their rest day at home, employers should not assign work to their FDW on the rest day. If FDWs agree to forgo their rest days, employers must provide compensation in lieu of the rest day. If FDWs have errands that they need to attend to on their rest day, they should be encouraged to take their rest day on a weekday, when public spaces are less crowded."
On March 5, "a court in Kyrgyzstan...banned mass rallies in the centre of the capital until July."
The government has suspended, indefinitely, all recruitment processes in the public administration due to concerns about the hike of coronavirus cases in the country

Colombia (cali) will start "pico y cedular" in cali starting April 6.This decision seeks to have the population shop in shifts in supermarkets, and commercial and banking establishments, with the repeated call to the people of Valle del Cauca to keep the coronavirus in isolation.

In Israel, on March 25, 2020, it was announced: "The employer is obligated to measure body temperature at the entrance to the workplace. A person with a temperature exceeding 38°C will not be permitted entrance."
Avoid travel to China's Hubei province, says Latvian Foreign Ministry on Jan 31

Canada, Nunavut, March 24 "Effective March 25, 2020, all travellers will be required to self-isolate at designated facilities outside of Nunavut for a period of 14 days, except for critical employees who are asymptomatic. Those returning to Nunavut will require approval from the Office of the Chief Public Health Officer."

Qatar's MOPH prohibits "Shisha/hookah in all restaurants and cafes operating in the country", effective as of March 10 until further notice, stressing that "anyone who violates this decision will be held accountable".

On 24 March, the European Commission adopted decisions on harmonised standards which will allow manufacturers to place on the market high performing devices to protect patients, health care professionals and citizens in general. The standards will facilitate a faster and less expensive conformity assessment procedure. The revised harmonised standards play a pivotal role in the current coronavirus pandemic because they relate to critical devices.
Kyrgyzstan on March 5: "Disinfection is carried out in markets and at catering establishments in Bishkek," with Chinese food establishments particularly targeted.

On 30 March, the European Commission issued guidelines allowing workers with “critical occupations” to cross EU internal borders amid the coronavirus crisis. Such occupations include health professionals, care workers, scientists, medical device
technicians, and others.
Kyrgyzstan on March 6, canceled "all the theatrical performances and concerts."
Yemen’s government has closed all educational institutions including schools, universities and vocational training schools for one week by mid of March.
Canada, Yukon, March 16 "Mass gatherings of more than 50 people are banned."
"All mosques in Kyrgyzstan to be disinfected because of coronavirus" as of March 6.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

The Ivory Coast declares the State of Emergency.
Togo to supply its citizens with a three-month free supply of water and electricity as they move into Coronavirus curfew

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On 16 March, the European Commission announced external border restrictions, meaning that the EU will close its external borders for 30 days, with exemptions for EU citizens coming back home, for healthcare workers, like doctors and nurses, also scientists working on the solution of this health crisis we do see, and for people commuting on borders, who are working on both sides of the border.
On Feb. 27 "Major international tournaments scheduled to be held in Kyrgyzstan have been cancelled."

On March 6th, Guatemala announces the launch of a Prevention Campaign in the education system that will involve principals, teachers, students, parent organizations and local authorities. Flyers, posters, and workshop materials were created and translated into all Guatemalan languages. Regions bordering Mexico are being prioritized.
As from 16 March 2020 the government of Tanzania shut down schools for 30 days.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The government in Yemen has extended the closure of universities and schools till March 29th. It originally was supposed to last only one week, starting mid March.

Canada, Yukon, March 18 "Dr. Brendan Hanley, Yukon’s Chief Medical Officer of Health, today declared a public health emergency under section 4.3 of the Public Health and Safety Act.

This declaration enables the Chief Medical Officer of Health to respond more quickly to the rapidly changing situation and to ensure the health and safety of Yukoners. The public health emergency will be in effect until further notice."

Latvia closes all non essential businesses from March 13. This includes: 
Nightclubs, entertainment centres, fitness clubs. Some restaurants and bars are open (e.g. take away). Shopping malls are closed. Exceptions are: food shops, press kiosks, pharmacies (incl. veterinary pharmacies), vaccination cabinets, opticians, pet food, dry cleaners, hygiene and household stores, building and garden supply stores.
Adjustment of the working hours of civil servants from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.

In a summit meeting on 26 March, the European Council announced that it will promote more corona-related research, including research into a vaccine: 140 million euros have been mobilised for 17 projects, including on vaccines.
Angola is closing universities after March 24

On February 10, Singapore released additional measures for taxis and  private hire cars. "Operators have reminded their drivers to continue to practise good personal hygiene/cleaning and disinfection of their vehicles. Drivers have been advised to wind down their vehicles’ windows when ferrying passengers with flu-like symptoms. Drivers have also been advised to take their temperature twice a day, once before starting work and another time in the course of the day, and those feeling unwell should stop work and see a doctor.
Canada, Yukon, March 18 "Classes are suspended at all Yukon public schools until April 15, or until further notice."

On March 29, the UAE limited the workforce of private entities to a maximum of 30% of the entire workforce. Under these measures, private entities must ensure the following: 
"1.  provide screening devices at their entrances to take temperature and check symptoms of the virus among workforce on a daily basis twice
2. ensuring that the number of transported workers should not exceed 25 percent of vehicle seating capacity
3.report any worker with coronavirus symptoms or any suspected cases"

Canada, Yukon, March 18 "All public indoor recreational facilities are required to close until further notice. This includes the Canada Games Centre, ice rinks and recreation centres. Additionally, all libraries are closed until further notice"
Creation of a National Solidarity and Economic Recovery Fund of 400 billion CFA francs.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Effective 15 March, Qatar extends suspension of entry "for citizens of Italy, France, Germany and Spain, as well as all others traveling from these countries. Individuals intending to travel from these four countries who are in possession of a Qatar residence permit are excluded from this decision, provided that they stay in a quarantine facility for 14 days as per the local procedures."
Angola, which had previously prohibited the entrance of citizens from Nigeria, Egypt, and Algeria, has taken them of the restricted list after March 4

In Kyrgyzstan on March 9, "The Education Ministry was instructed to permanently hold awareness raising campaigns among schoolchildren and students about coronavirus and personal hygiene rules to prevent virus spread."
The Ivory Coast forbids the circulation of people between Abidjan and the other cities with the exception of those trips intended to gather food or items of first necessity.

Republic of Congo and the Congolese Ministry of Health announced March 3rd new quarantine measures for fear of an outbreak in the country. Health authorities also announced "the quarantine of any travelers with COVID-19 symptoms (fever and cough)"

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

The Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of Antigua and Barbuda closed the schools early on the 16th of march. School staff and teachers had to prepare the closing on the 16th and the 17th of March.

As part of the management of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Togo, the Government has set up a short number 113, exclusively dedicated to the health monitoring of people who entered the national territory since March 2, 2020.
"Transport Ministry of Kyrgyzstan holding awareness-raising works on flu and Covid-19 prevention among drivers," since March 9.

On February 10, Singapore released an advisory for taxi operators regarding temperature checks; "eight temperature screening stations across all taxi operators’ premises will be set up from 11 February 2020.  Taxi drivers whose temperature fall within the acceptable range will receive a sticker for the day to indicate that their temperatures have been checked. Taxi drivers who are identified to be unwell will be asked to seek medical attention immediately and visit the doctor. For private hire car (PHC) drivers, operators will, as a start, require their drivers to take their own temperature and to submit their temperature readings via their mobile applications. Unwell passengers are asked to wear the masks from the 4 masks/household drive the government is doing. the Government is making a one-time contribution of 300,000 surgical masks active taxi and PHC drivers. These masks are intended for drivers to offer to passengers who are unwell but do not have a mask and need a ride to seek medical attention"

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

As of 23 March 2020, COVID-19 testing in Trinidad and Tobago has been expanded. The Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) will expand its testing to test anyone who meets any of the criteria for COVID-19 exposure.

Angola is purchasing 280 ventilators, 9 million masks, 80,000 bio-security kits, tests and thermometers from China
Kiribati closed schools for a period of two weeks from 30 March.

In Madagascar, as of April 3,2020, all of Madagascar is in a State of Health Emergency.

With the curfew imposed in Antigua and Barbuda from the 28th of March, all non-essential services and businesses are to remain closed for two weeks.

As part of its State of Calamity Decree, Guatemala announces on March 6th that it will establish minimum and maximum prices for items, goods, supplies or services that are related in any way to the prevention, treatment, containment and response to Coronavirus (COVID-19) and related medical procedures.

Vanuatu introduced additional border protection for those who have been in or transited through any part of China, Taiwan, Macau or Hong Kong in the past 14 days. Denial of entry. Effective from 01/31/20202.

Except:
Passengers who have traveled to or been in mainland China, Hong Kong, Macao, or Taiwan as of December 31, and spent the 14 days prior to their arrival in Vanuatu in another country, will be required to provide a medical certification issued by a doctor stating that they do not have respiratory illnesses.

Any traveler showing symptoms of respiratory illness (fever, runny nose, flu-like condition, headache, chest pain, or breathing difficulties) must provide a medical certificate indicating a negative result of the 2019-nCoV coronavirus test.
Hungary suspended flights from Milan to Budapest and Debrecen

In Madagascar, as of March 28,2020, per the latest State of Emergency requirements, strict confinement measures are in place starting at 12 pm. only those with valid authorization will be allowed to move around outside.
Government employees in Antigua and Barbuda are recommended to take vacation leave where possible. This request was published with the 24 hour curfew beginning at the 2nd of April.

As part of its State of Calamity Decree, Guatemala announces on March 6th that the purchase of goods and supplies is authorized as well as the contracting of services without being subject to the requirements established by the Ley de Contrataciones del Estado y su Reglamento.

In Madagascar, as of March 26,2020, confinement measures have been put in place in order to curb the communal spread of COVID-19. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

Hungary performs thermal screenings on all Iranian airplane passengers arriving in the country

On February 10, Singapore released advisories for dormitories to enhance measures to mitigate the spread of the virus. "Key measures include: suspending all mass activities to minimise risk of infections among residents, staggering the usage of common dormitory facilities,
making arrangements for residents on Leave of Absence (LOA) to reside together with others on LOA, in a section of the dormitory that is separate from other residents, or having dedicated rooms for them, and making arrangements for food so that residents on LOA need not leave the premises."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
Vanuata, March 4, authorities announced that new entry requirements were to be implimented.

 All travelers traveling from or transiting through mainland China, Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan, South Korea, Japan, or Singapore since Tuesday, December 31, must have been quarantined for a minimum of 14 days in a third party country before their arrival in Vanuatu. All such travelers who are not Vanuatu residents must provide a medical certificate confirming they do not have and are not suspected to have COVID-19.
The Ministry of Health and Welfare announces a task force to respond to corona virus
Hungary declared a state of emergency due to COVID-19

On March 28 2020, the UAE Attorney General imposed a "AED50,000 fine for violating mandatory hospitalisation by patients who directly refuse to receive or continue prescribed medicines despite being instructed. Concerned entities or specialists may contact relevant authorities to enforce the decision:
Hungary closed down its universities
Both the internationally recognised government in Tripoli, in the west, and a rival administration ruling from Benghazi in the east have declared emergency.
Hungary banned class trips abroad and suspended a summer language program for schools across the country
Myanmar closes elephant camps to all visitors, announced on March 25.
On March 15th, 2020, Libya declares a state of emergency and allocates half a billion dinars (approximately $352 221 633) to face the pandemic.
Hungary introduced border control at its borders with Slovenia and Austria
As of March 17, 2020, Benin makes it obligatory for public transport providers to provide their employees and passengers with appropriate masks or bibs
Hungary placed an entry ban on all non-Hungarian citizens from Iran, China, South Korea and Italy

Citizens of Antigua and Barbuda as well as resident diplomats will be allowed entry"
The government of Yemen has implemented an isolation center in the only training hospital in the city of Al-Maqar and arranged for providing an isolation center in the Dhamar General Hospital.
Myanmar closes beach Ngapali to tourists and discontinues tourism activities there, announced on March 29.
Since Feb. 6 Kiribati requires travellers to "self-Quarantine at home to minimize spread of infection".
Hungary announced a government-enforced quarantine at homes and hospitals for COVID-19 patients
Mali closes all bars and clubs on March 17th, effective on March 19th until further notice.

This includes anyone returning home from other provinces and territories by road or air, as well as Yukoners returning home by road from Alaska. We are putting mechanisms in place to monitor and ensure travelers are self-isolating."
From January 23, operations of all travel agencies in Hubei, China were suspected.
Yangon (Myanmar) asks restaurants to close dine-services and only operate take-away starting March 28.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
Canada, Yukon, March 22 "Gatherings of more than 10 people are banned. Smaller gatherings should ensure spacing of two metres between people. Yukoners should not attend any social gatherings, even those with less than 10 people if:
You have any flu-like symptoms at all;
You are over 65 years of age or have an underlying health condition; or
You work in healthcare, a healthcare facility or other essential services."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)

In Palestine, March 06, "The Palestinian Authority has declared a state of emergency in the occupied West Bank over the coronavirus epidemic after seven people tested positive."
Iceland announces that people will have to keep a distance of 2 meters in common areas starting from the 24th of March
Yemen’s minister of sports Nayef Al-Bakri suspended all sports activities from 17.03.2020.
Wuhan, China ordered the public to wear masks in public places on January 22

Canada, Yukon, March 22 "Restaurants must immediately reduce their seating capacity to 50 per cent, space people two metres apart, and prepare to offer take-out and delivery service only as of opening on March 26. As of closing time tonight, March 22, all bars must close until further notice.
All personal service establishments must close by end of day, Wednesday, March 25. This includes hair salons, barber shops, tattoo parlors, nail salons, and massage therapists."

As of March 17, 2020, Benin recommends religious leaders to ensure that, during worship services, the health safety distance of at least one meter between worshipers is respected, and to avoid handshakes, hugs and all other contaminating gestures
The government announces the expansion of quarantine personnel and conversion of public health centres

Nepal's trade with China has been halted completely following the closure of the Rasuwagadi border — the major trade point between the two nations — due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The government shut Rasuwagadi border on January 28 to prevent the spread of coronavirus after the number of infections in China soared. As a result, Nepal-China trade has been completely halted.

Trade with China will resume only after the coronavirus outbreak is brought under control, but nobody knows when that will happen
Liberia is restricting people from countries with more than 200 positive corona virus cases from entering the country till further notice.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry (type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Canada, Yukon, March 27 "The Government of Yukon is declaring a state of emergency under the Civil Emergency Measures Act in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This does not indicate a significant change in circumstances or an increased risk to Yukoners but prepares the government to take rapid action if needed."

On March 28 2020, the UAE Attorney General imposed a series of fines regarding the failure of complying with precautionary measures:
- AED3,000 fine for refusing an order to dispose of any stuff, clothes, luggage or others proved to be contaminated or might be contaminated by any pathogen if they can’t be disinfected by established procedures.
- AED10,000 fine for failing to take precautionary measures for the crew of shelter ships.
- AED3,000 fine for violating the executive regulations of the Law on Communicable Diseases when burying or transporting a dead body infected with a communicable disease.

The UAE Attorney General imposed fines on the failure of closing public years:
- AED50,000 fine and administrative closure for failing to temporarily suspend an establishment. AED500 fine will be issued for a customer.
- AED50,000 fine and administrative closure for violating the closure instructions of educational institutions, cinemas, gyms, sports clubs, malls, outdoor markets, parks, cafés, shopping centres and restaurants and others or for receiving customers. A visitor to such establishments will be slapped with fine of AED500.

The UAE Attorney General imposed fines for not maintaing social distancing:
- AED1,000 fine for a motorist who exceeds the number of passengers in his car (more than three persons per car).
- AED10,000 fine for whoever invites or organises gatherings, meetings, private and public celebrations or being present in groups at public places or private farms. Participants will also be slapped a fine of AED5,000.
- AED3,000 fine for failing to take proper health measures regarding regulation of markets, roads, and other public places exempted from temporally closure.
- AED1,000 fine for unnecessarily visiting health facilities.

The UAE Attorney General imposed a "AED5,000 fine for the executive in charge of managing a company or a facility that violates the sterilisation measures of public or private means of transportation."

The UAE Attorney General imposed fines for leaving home:
- AED3,000 fine for individuals violating the curfew set out during the National Disinfection Programme by the Ministry of Health and Prevention and the Ministry of Interior. The fine excludes individuals who sought to obtain essential supplies, such as food and medicine, and individuals working within previously designated vital sectors.
-AED2,000 fine for any person leaving his home for unnecessary reasons except for performing vital jobs or buying essential necessities.
On Monday, March 16th, Libya's UN-recognized Government of National Accord (GNA) suspended all flights at the Misrata Airport for three weeks.

The UAE Attorney General imposed fines for not complying with health checks 
- AED50,000 fine for non-compliance with home quarantine instructions as per the home quarantine manuals, and quarantine at private facilities determined by competent authorities and refusing to take the test again as per health protocols or implementing these measures.
-  AED5,000 fine for refusing to subject to a medical test upon request.
- AED2,000 fine for violating precautionary measures issued by the Ministry of Health and Prevention by passengers coming to the UAE from countries infected by a communicable disease.

As of March 17, 2020, Benin makes it obligatory for banks, supermarkets, bars, restaurants, businesses and other establishments open to the public to provide protective and hygienic measures and to ensure that customers and users observe the safety distance between them.
